results.title: Lucky Luciano
results.creator_credit: Franco Cristaldi, Harbor Productions, VIDES Cinematografica, Les Films de la Boetie and Francesco Rosi
results.brief_description: Inspired by real life events, ‘Lucky Luciano’ follows the infamous crime boss (Gian Maria Volonte) from the time he was pardoned after serving nine years of his 50-year sentence in the 1930s and 1940s, to his deportation to Italy. Once in Italy, Luciano is jailed for 10 years by narcotics investigator Charles Siragusa (playing himself in the film) who is trying to bring down a drug smuggling empire going from strength to strength. With ‘Lucky Luciano’ Rosi returns to his favourite theme, the connections between legal and illegal exercises of power (already present in films such as ‘Hands over the City’, also starring Rod Steiger). Rosi exposes the entanglement of the CIA and mob heroin-mongers during and in the years following World War II. Cast includes Edmund O’Brien, Charles Siragusa, Rod Steiger and Vincent Gardenia. The Italian-speaking actors are dubbed in English. Reference: San Francisco International Film Festival (1997). http://www.sfiff.org/festivals/1997/thefilms/html/bymaker_82.html
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Cristaldi, Harbor Productions, VIDES Cinematografica, Les Films de la Boetie and Francesco Rosi

results.title: Lucky dip
results.brief_description: Late at night the tired staff of a French restaurant prepare to go home only to find some lovestruck diners on the verge of a marriage proposal still lingering behind the potted palms. What promises to be the perfect end to a romantic night goes horribly wrong when the prospective bride accidently swallows the ring. The lurid, expressionist painted animation effect emphasises the absurdity and grotesqueness of the couples’ behaviour.

results.title: Lucky
results.creator_credit: John Goldschmidt and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
A boy of 18 re-enacts the way he left his home in Devon and went to London, without money but with high hopes. There he keeps alive cadging and stealing. He takes drugs and is eventually taken to hospital after collapsing on the street. Following this, he is put in touch with the Department of Social Security who help in his rehabilitation.

results.title: Luckily I need little sleep
results.brief_description: Kathy worked as a nurse in Greece and then came to Canada. She and her family live in northern Alberta, where they are developing a farm. Kathy works outside the home as a nurse, sews for the children, maintains the house, and helps with the farm work.

results.title: Lucio Fontana: reaching out into space
results.creator_credit: Pierre Neel, RM Arts and Poorhouse Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
The founder and major practitioner of the spatialist movement in art in the 1940s, Lucio Fontana, is the feature of this thorough and personal documentary which covers the expanse of his working career and his ongoing fascination with the concept and evolution of space in artistic practice. Through discussion of his major manifesto’s on the theory of spatialism and the range of work in multiple media through which he expressed his ideas and preoccupations, the program explores the notion of bringing real as opposed to illusory space into art and assesses Fontana’s achievement in the expression of this in the experimentation that marks his celebrated career. The program also traces his derivation of inspiration in creating art forms which are said to break out into space in the traditions of Baroque art and architecture as well as his influence on other artists of the same and subsequent periods. Through interviews with colleagues, friends, family and art critics, a profile of the artist emerges in both personal and artistic terms, with a celebration of the progression of his work and the importance of his impact on artistic expression for his multimedia experimentation, theoretical sophistication and professed feeling for humanity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre Neel, RM Arts and Poorhouse Productions

results.title: Lucie Aubrac [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Pierre Grunstein, Renn Productions and Claude Berri
results.brief_description: Loosely based on Lucie Aubrac’s account of her time in the French Resistance - ‘Outwitting the Gestapo’, Claude Berri’s film is an attempt at recreating the style of classic war films, in which a love story unfolds against a backdrop of action and danger. Devoted couple Lucie (Carole Bouquet) and Raymond Aubrac (Daniel Auteuil) are both heavily involved in a Resistance network operating in the Lyons area. Summoned to attend a a secret meeting with other Resistance leaders, Raymond is arrested by the Gestapo following treason from an insider to the movement. Taken to the infamous Montluc prison, Raymond is interrogated by Klaus Barbie. Desperate to save her husband, Lucie makes every attempt to establish contact with Raymond and set him free in time to celebrate their anniversary. Her first ploy is to pass for Aubrac’s pregnant girlfriend and to plea with Barbie to let her marry the father of her child and save her reputation. Then comes the organisation of Raymond’s escape during a prisoner transport. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Lucia di Lammermoor = Lucia of Lammermoor by Donizetti
results.creator_credit: George Richfield, Official Films, Richfield Operatic Films and E. Cancellieri
results.brief_description: Donizetti’s tragic opera featuring members of the Scala of Milano and the Opera House of Rome with musical arrangement and script by Raffaele Gervasio and starring Anna Lollobrigida as Lucia.

results.title: Lucia di Lammermoor
results.creator_credit: John Copley, Opera Australia, ABC-TV (Australia) and Peter Butler
results.brief_description: Dame Joan Sutherland brings to life Donizetti’s tragic heroine who murders her bridegroom on their wedding night. This breathtaking production by the Australian Opera also features Richard Greager and Malcolm Donnelly. The production was recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, February 8, 1986.

results.title: Lucia
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC), Raul Canosa, Camilo Vives and Humberto Solas
results.brief_description: Acclaimed worldwide as the `Gone With the Wind of the Cuban film industry’, ‘Lucia’ is indeed Cuba’s first film spectacular, an epic, three-part feature film dramatizing three separate periods in the Cuban struggle for liberation in order to show the participation of Cuban women in that fight. In 1895, Lucia is embroiled in a tale of love and betrayal during Cuba’s war for independence from Spain; in 1933, Lucia leaves her middle-class family and becomes involved in the overthrow of the Cuban dictator Machado; and in the 1960’s, Lucia is taught how to read and write during Cuba’s literacy campaign and, as a newlywed, confronts her husband’s macho attitudes. Each episode is filmed in a distinctive visual style which translates the spirit of each historical era, with the themes of love, death and war achieving epic proportions, and providing the viewer with a good example of the role of women in history. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Raquel Revuelta, Eduardo Maure and Eslinda Nunez. (Awards: Golden Globe 1969)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC), Raul Canosa, Camilo Vives and Humberto Solas
